title: Pharmacotherapeutic role of astringin against chromium induced nephrotoxicity via modulating TLR4/MyD88, HMGB1/RAGE and NF-κB pathway: A biochemical and pharmacokinetic approach.
abstract: Chromium (Cr) is a noxious heavy metal that is reported to induce various organ damages including the kidneys. Astringin (ATN) is a polyphenolic flavonoid that demonstrates immense pharmacological potential.
journal: Journal of trace elements in medicine and biology : organ of the Society for Minerals and Trace Elements (GMS)
